intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. storeyi, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers, which are typically arranged in cymes. It is native to regions of eastern Asia, including China and Japan, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Hedyotis acuminata f. storeyi is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it contributes to the understory vegetation.
